author: Staff Reporter
text:
A.G. Perarivalan and other life convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case are hopeful that the State government will release them on account of the birth anniversary of former Chief Minister MGR, said Arputhammal, Perarivalan’s mother, after meeting him in the Vellore Central Prison for Men on Thursday.

“My son and other six life convicts are expecting an announcement on their release from the government by January 20. They had also submitted petitions to the government in this regard. He asked me not to worry and stay confident,” she said.

She pointed out that Perarivalan has spent 25 years in prison and had expected that he will be with them this Pongal. “I hope he will be with us for Pongal next year and I came here to see him to instil this hope in him,” she added.
title: Arputhammal hopes for release of her son, other life convicts
